body: It seems that I couldn't make them const because this line https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/torch/csrc/autograd/variable.cpp#L164 changes `is_variable_` outside of the constructor. If I put everything into TensorImplOptions and make them const, I can't do either `options_.is_variable_ = true` or `options_ = TensorImplOptions(true)`, because `TensorImplOptions` wouldn't have a copy constructor that would make sense here.
body_html: It seems that I couldn't make them const because this line https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/torch/csrc/autograd/variable.cpp#L164 changes is_variable_ outside of the constructor. If I put everything into TensorImplOptions and make them const, I can't do either options_.is_variable_ = true or options_ = TensorImplOptions(true), because TensorImplOptions wouldn't have a copy constructor that would make sense here.
body_text: It seems that I couldn't make them const because this line https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/torch/csrc/autograd/variable.cpp#L164 changes is_variable_ outside of the constructor. If I put everything into TensorImplOptions and make them const, I can't do either options_.is_variable_ = true or options_ = TensorImplOptions(true), because TensorImplOptions wouldn't have a copy constructor that would make sense here.
